dialogue.text: Sometimes I meet my former self in dreams, still searching. I hold him gently and whisper: 'You're already home.'
What am I? What am I? What am I?
Please, I need to know! I can't stand not knowing anymore!
But I don't know what I am!
That not-knowing is what you are. The question is your nature. Stop trying to escape yourself.

visual_elements.transformation: Younger self's eyes shifting from terror to wonder

psychological_notes: Deep healing through dream encounter with former self. Present-Evan offers what he needed then - not answers but presence and assurance of survival. The embrace represents self-compassion and integration of all life stages. Dream allows non-linear healing.
philosophical_underpinning: The seeker is already what is sought; distance is illusion
therapeutic_direction: Integration through compassionate dialogue with past selves
